etymology.description: semantic: 辰(辰) (chén, 'fifth earthly branch') + phonetic: 曲(曲) (qū, 'bent') = farm work at the time of 辰 -> agriculture, farming
etymology.interpretation: The character 农(農) (nóng, 'farmer; agriculture') conveys the concept of farming activities aligned with the cycles of time, represented by 辰(辰) (chén, 'fifth earthly branch') which signifies a specific time, and 曲(曲) (qū, 'bent') indicating the physical nature of farm work.
etymology.simplification: 农(農) was simplified by removing the 田(田) (tián, 'field') radical and using a simplified form of the original components.

examples.chinese: 他是一位农民(他是一位農民)。
他专注于农业研究(他專注於農業研究)，推广农耕技术(推廣農耕技術)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhuānzhù yú nóngyè yánjiū, tuīguǎng nónggēng jìshù.
examples.english: He focuses on agricultural research and promotes farming techniques.

examples.chinese: 古时候有农夫耕作(古時候有農夫耕作)，辛勤劳作(辛勤勞作)，换来丰收(換來豐收)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ shíhòu yǒu nóngfū gēngzuò, xīnqín láozuò, huàn lái fēngshōu.
examples.english: In ancient times, farmers toiled in the fields, working hard and reaped a bountiful harvest.
